definition: lit. made by Heaven and arranged by Earth(idiom)/ideal/perfect/(of a match) made in heaven/to be made for one another
day/sky/heaven
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: Jo and Ian are a perfect match for each other.
sentences.chinese: 乔和伊恩真是天造地设的一对儿。

sentences.english: Don: that they're a match made in heaven?
sentences.chinese: 他们是天造地设的一对？

sentences.english: Jack and Mary are cut out for each other.
sentences.chinese: 杰克和玛丽真是天造地设的一对。

sentences.english: I think we are made for each other.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们是天造地设的一对。

sentences.english: " He called the proposed acquisition a "marriage made in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他称该项收购提议是一个“天造地设的良缘”。

sentences.english: This is almost a match made in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 这绝对是天造地设的一对。

sentences.english: Everybody had the impression that she was a good match for the young man.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都觉得她和那年轻人是天造地设的一对。
我们俩是天造地设的一对。

sentences.english: You see two people, they belong together, but nothing happens.
sentences.chinese: 你会看到天造地设的两个人，却始终没能在一起。

sentences.english: For coffee lovers, chocolate and coffee are a match made in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 对于咖啡爱好者，巧克力和咖啡真是天造地设的绝配。

sentences.english: Jim: Oh, I'm sorry , I thought you two were made for each other.
sentences.chinese: 哦，对不起，我认为你们是天造地设的一对。

definition: a match made in heaven (idiom)
talented man and beautiful woman/ideal couple
string of pearl and jade (idiom); ideal combination/perfect pair
perfect match
to be well matched/to suit
lit. golden boys and jade maidens (idiom)/attendants of the Daoist immortals/fig. lovely young children/a golden couple/(of a couple who are in the public eye) a lovely young couple
talented man and beautiful woman/ideal couple
to match/well-suited
too wonderful for words
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
happily married couple
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
love at first sight
in perfect harmony/in sync/lit. qin and se sing in harmony
love is more solid than gold (idiom)
to resemble nature itself/of the highest quality (idiom)
